required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: "Impact of the Third Molars in Oral Health-related Quality of Life"
clinical_study.official_title: "Impact of the Third Molars in Oral Health-related Quality of Life"

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to evaluate the impact of the third molars in oral health-related quality of life, before and after surgical removal using a validated and frequently used in international investigations instrument (OHIP-14).

detailed_description.textblock: This is a prospective study that evaluates the oral health-related quality of life through the application of the self-administered OHIP-14 before and after the surgical removal of third molars. The inclusion criteria were adults' patients older than 18 years, referred for oral surgery. Patients with chronic diseases and acute pericoronitis were excluded. The assessment was performed at three times: pre-surgical planning 1 day before surgery (T0), 10 days (T1) and 2 - 3 months after surgery (T2)

primary_outcome.measure: changes in oral health related quality of life after orthognathic surgery assessed with Short form Oral Health Impact Profile (OHIP-14)
primary_outcome.time_frame: baseline to 10 days and 2 - 3 months after surgery
primary_outcome.description: Short form Oral Health Impact Profile (OHIP-14) was applied at 3 times: baseline, one week before surgery (T1), 10 days after surgery (T2) and 2 - 3 months after surgery (T3). A paired t-test was used to assess the mean (SD) changes in patients undergoing orthognathic surgery. The magnitude of the change was evaluated calculating the standardized response mean (SRM). The Short Form Oral Health Impact Profile (OHIP-14) is an instrument for assessment oral health-related quality of life. 14 ítems values: min = 0 / max = 56 higher scores mean a worse outcome

intervention.description: ambulatory surgical intervention of the maxilla and / or mandible for third molar removal

study_pop.textblock: Patients over 18 years old submmited to third molars surgical removal

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adults patients over 18 years old
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with chronic diseases and acute pericoronitis
